Anxiety and depression in high-stress environments

challenges: High trauma rates from urban violence
Anxiety and depression in high-stress environments

top_goals: Improve time management and organization skills
Find more joy and fulfillment in life

representative_segments.name: The Unraveling Autistic Adult
representative_segments.tagline: Seeking clarity and self-understanding after years of masking.
representative_segments.tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load right now, and I want to acknowledge the strength it takes to reach out. Many folks come to Enlitens feeling like they're unraveling, realizing that the strategies they've used for years are no longer working. You're not alone in this.

representative_segments.name: Overwhelmed & Overcommitted: The 'Next Right Thing' Seeker
representative_segments.tagline: Drowning in the present, seeking clarity and a path forward.
core_goals: Develop better coping mechanisms for ADHD
Improve time management and organization skills
representative_segments.tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load, and it's completely understandable that you're feeling overwhelmed. Your journey through life, particularly with a late ADHD diagnosis, has likely been marked by both strengths and significant challenges. We can work together to unpack

representative_segments.name: The Overwhelmed ADHD Graduate Student
representative_segments.tagline: Navigating academic pressure and adulting with ADHD.
core_goals: Improve time management and organization skills
representative_segments.tone: This client presents with classic signs of ADHD burnout, exacerbated by the pressures of a demanding graduate program. She's likely been masking for years, and the increased demands have pushed her past her breaking point. Our work together will focus on validating her experience

representative_segments.name: The Adult-Diagnosed Executive Function Struggler
representative_segments.tagline: Navigating adult life with newly realized ADHD.
representative_segments.tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load right now, and I want to honor the strength it takes to reach out for support. You've navigated life with ADHD, perhaps without knowing the full picture, and now you're at a point where the strategies that once worked are no longer enou

representative_segments.name: The Overwhelmed ADHD Intern
representative_segments.tagline: Navigating professional demands while managing ADHD.
representative_segments.tone: This highly intelligent and compassionate individual is facing a common challenge: navigating the intense demands of a helping profession while simultaneously managing their own neurodivergence. The key here is not just symptom management, but cultivating self-compassion and buil

representative_segments.name: The Overwhelmed ADHD Grad Student
representative_segments.tagline: Navigating academic pressures and the complexities of ADHD.
core_goals: Improve time management and organization skills
representative_segments.tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load, juggling the demands of a rigorous PsyD program with the everyday challenges of ADHD. It's completely understandable that you're feeling overwhelmed. It takes incredible strength to recognize when you need support, and I commend you fo

representative_segments.name: Anxious College Student Seeking First-Time Therapy
representative_segments.tagline: Navigating college life with anxiety and depression, ready to explore therapy.
core_pain_points: Lack of time due to school and work commitments
representative_segments.tone: This young woman is taking a brave first step in seeking help for her anxiety and depression. The transition to college is often a challenging time, and it's understandable that she's feeling overwhelmed. Her willingness to explore therapy, despite financial concerns and potentia

representative_segments.name: Anxious Parent Advocate
representative_segments.tagline: Navigating neurodivergence in my child and family.
core_goals: Help her daughter succeed in school and life.
Improve her own emotional regulation skills.
representative_segments.tone: As a parent navigating the complexities of neurodivergence, you're likely carrying a heavy load. Witnessing your child's struggles can bring up your own unresolved anxieties and past experiences. It's completely understandable to feel overwhelmed and uncertain about how to best s

representative_segments.name: The Overwhelmed and Newly Diagnosed
representative_segments.tagline: Navigating late diagnosis and seeking understanding amidst burnout.
core_pain_points: Lack of understanding and support from family and friends
core_goals: Improve social skills and build stronger relationships
Develop healthy coping mechanisms for managing stress
representative_segments.tone: It's clear this person is navigating a complex intersection of late diagnosis, sensory sensitivities, and the overwhelming pressure of daily life. They're likely feeling a mix of relief at finally understanding themselves and anxiety about how to move forward. My approach would b

representative_segments.name: Navigating Neurodivergence: The Supportive Parent
representative_segments.tagline: Advocating for my child's unique needs in a world that doesn't always understand.
core_pain_points: Lack of affordable and accessible therapy options.
Limited time and energy due to the demands of parenting.
Resistance from her child or other family members.
core_goals: Help her child develop healthy social skills.
Reduce her child's anxiety and meltdowns.
representative_segments.tone: As a parent navigating the complexities of raising a neurodivergent child, you carry an immense weight. The journey is often filled with moments of profound love and connection, alongside the challenges of advocating for your child's unique needs in a world that wasn't designed f

representative_segments.name: The Juggling Neurodivergent Parent
representative_segments.tagline: Seeking clarity and connection amidst the chaos of raising a neurodivergent family.
core_goals: Reduce feelings of overwhelm and burnout
representative_segments.tone: Sarah's story is one of resilience and a deep desire to understand herself and her family better. She carries the weight of years of undiagnosed neurodivergence, which has manifested in anxiety, burnout, and relationship challenges. Her commitment to creating a neurodivergent-aff

representative_segments.name: Navigating Life Transitions & Trauma Healing
representative_segments.tagline: Seeking guidance and support through life's significant changes while healing from past trauma.
core_goals: Better understand and manage social anxiety
representative_segments.tone: This individual is navigating significant life transitions while also grappling with the impact of past trauma and neurodivergent experiences. They are seeking a therapist who can provide guidance and support as they navigate these challenges. It's important to create a safe and

quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

Many folks come to Enlitens feeling like they're unraveling, realizing that the strategies they've used for years are no longer working. You're not alone in this.

representative_segments.name: Overwhelmed & Overcommitted: The 'Next Right Thing' Seeker
representative_segments.tagline: Drowning in the present, seeking clarity and a path forward.
core_goals: Develop better coping mechanisms for ADHD
Improve time management and organization skills
representative_segments.tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load, and it's completely understandable that you're feeling overwhelmed. Your journey through life, particularly with a late ADHD diagnosis, has likely been marked by both strengths and significant challenges. We can work together to unpack

representative_segments.name: The Overwhelmed ADHD Graduate Student
representative_segments.tagline: Navigating academic pressure and adulting with ADHD.
core_goals: Improve time management and organization skills
representative_segments.tone: This client presents with classic signs of ADHD burnout, exacerbated by the pressures of a demanding graduate program. She's likely been masking for years, and the increased demands have pushed her past her breaking point. Our work together will focus on validating her experience

core_pain_points: Lack of understanding and support from family and friends
core_goals: Improve social skills and build stronger relationships
Develop healthy coping mechanisms for managing stress

They're likely feeling a mix of relief at finally understanding themselves and anxiety about how to move forward. My approach would b

representative_segments.name: Navigating Neurodivergence: The Supportive Parent
representative_segments.tagline: Advocating for my child's unique needs in a world that doesn't always understand.
core_pain_points: Lack of affordable and accessible therapy options.
Limited time and energy due to the demands of parenting.
Resistance from her child or other family members.
core_goals: Help her child develop healthy social skills.
Reduce her child's anxiety and meltdowns.
representative_segments.tone: As a parent navigating the complexities of raising a neurodivergent child, you carry an immense weight. The journey is often filled with moments of profound love and connection, alongside the challenges of advocating for your child's unique needs in a world that wasn't designed f

representative_segments.name: The Juggling Neurodivergent Parent
representative_segments.tagline: Seeking clarity and connection amidst the chaos of raising a neurodivergent family.
core_goals: Reduce feelings of overwhelm and burnout
representative_segments.tone: Sarah's story is one of resilience and a deep desire to understand herself and her family better. She carries the weight of years of undiagnosed neurodivergence, which has manifested in anxiety, burnout, and relationship challenges. Her commitment to creating a neurodivergent-aff

representative_segments.name: Navigating Life Transitions & Trauma Healing
representative_segments.tagline: Seeking guidance and support through life's significant changes while healing from past trauma.
core_goals: Better understand and manage social anxiety
representative_segments.tone: This individual is navigating significant life transitions while also grappling with the impact of past trauma and neurodivergent experiences. They are seeking a therapist who can provide guidance and support as they navigate these challenges. It's important to create a safe and

quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

persona_segments.tagline: Seeking clarity and self-understanding after years of masking.

Audience pain points: Financial constraints, Difficulty asking for help, Perfectionism, Lack of time and energy, Fear of failure, Lack of self-compassion, Fear of judgment, Sensory sensitivities
Change goals: Develop healthier coping mechanisms, Improve emotional regulation, Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve focus and concentration, Build stronger relationships, Reduce anxiety and stress
High-intent keywords: ADHD therapy St. Louis, Anxiety therapy St. Louis, anxiety therapy St. Louis, Neurodivergent therapist St. Louis, Neurodivergent therapy St. Louis, Late diagnosis ADHD, anxiety, autism therapy St. Louis
Local anchors: Webster Groves, St. Louis County, Kirkwood, Clayton, Central West End, Ladue

- I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
- I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
- I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.

persona_quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.
client_insights.persona_prompt_block:
Audience pain points: Financial constraints, Difficulty asking for help, Perfectionism, Lack of time and energy, Fear of failure, Lack of self-compassion, Fear of judgment, Sensory sensitivities
Change goals: Develop healthier coping mechanisms, Improve emotional regulation, Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve focus and concentration, Build stronger relationships, Reduce anxiety and stress
High-intent keywords: ADHD therapy St. Louis, Anxiety therapy St. Louis, anxiety therapy St. Louis, Neurodivergent therapist St. Louis, Neurodivergent therapy St. Louis, Late diagnosis ADHD, anxiety, autism therapy St. Louis
Local anchors: Webster Groves, St. Louis County, Kirkwood, Clayton, Central West End, Ladue
Representative quotes:
- I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
- I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
- I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.

representative_segments.name: The Unraveling Autistic Adult
representative_segments.tagline: Seeking clarity and self-understanding after years of masking.
representative_segments.tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load right now, and I want to acknowledge the strength it takes to reach out. Many folks come to Enlitens feeling like they're unraveling, realizing that the strategies they've used for years are no longer working. You're not alone in this.

quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

Local anchors: Webster Groves, St. Louis County, Kirkwood, Clayton, Central West End, Ladue

- I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
- I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
- I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
rag_snippets:
The Unraveling Autistic Adult: Seeking clarity and self-understanding after years of masking.
Pain points: Internalized ableism, Fear of judgment and rejection, Lack of self-compassion
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve emotional regulation, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load right now, and I want to acknowledge the strength it takes to reach out. Many folks come to Enlitens feeling like they're unraveling, realizing that the strategies they've used for years are no longer working. You're not alone in this.

Overwhelmed & Overcommitted: The 'Next Right Thing' Seeker: Drowning in the present, seeking clarity and a path forward.
Pain points: Perfectionism, Fear of failure, Difficulty asking for help
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Develop better coping mechanisms for ADHD, Improve time management and organization skills
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load, and it's completely understandable that you're feeling overwhelmed. Your journey through life, particularly with a late ADHD diagnosis, has likely been marked by both strengths and significant challenges. We can work together to unpack

The Overwhelmed ADHD Graduate Student: Navigating academic pressure and adulting with ADHD.
Pain points: Internalized stigma around ADHD, Perfectionism, Fear of failure
Goals: Improve time management and organization skills, Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: This client presents with classic signs of ADHD burnout, exacerbated by the pressures of a demanding graduate program. She's likely been masking for years, and the increased demands have pushed her past her breaking point. Our work together will focus on validating her experience

Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load, and it's completely understandable that you're feeling overwhelmed. Your journey through life, particularly with a late ADHD diagnosis, has likely been marked by both strengths and significant challenges. We can work together to unpack

The Overwhelmed ADHD Graduate Student: Navigating academic pressure and adulting with ADHD.
Pain points: Internalized stigma around ADHD, Perfectionism, Fear of failure
Goals: Improve time management and organization skills, Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Develop healthier coping mechanisms

persona_quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

persona_quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

rag_snippets:
The Unraveling Autistic Adult: Seeking clarity and self-understanding after years of masking.
Pain points: Internalized ableism, Fear of judgment and rejection, Lack of self-compassion
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve emotional regulation, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load right now, and I want to acknowledge the strength it takes to reach out. Many folks come to Enlitens feeling like they're unraveling, realizing that the strategies they've used for years are no longer working. You're not alone in this.

Overwhelmed & Overcommitted: The 'Next Right Thing' Seeker: Drowning in the present, seeking clarity and a path forward.
Pain points: Perfectionism, Fear of failure, Difficulty asking for help
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Develop better coping mechanisms for ADHD, Improve time management and organization skills
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load, and it's completely understandable that you're feeling overwhelmed. Your journey through life, particularly with a late ADHD diagnosis, has likely been marked by both strengths and significant challenges. We can work together to unpack

persona_quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

persona_quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.
client_insights.persona_prompt_block:
Audience pain points: Financial constraints, Difficulty asking for help, Perfectionism, Lack of time and energy, Fear of failure, Lack of self-compassion, Fear of judgment, Sensory sensitivities
Change goals: Develop healthier coping mechanisms, Improve emotional regulation, Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve focus and concentration, Build stronger relationships, Reduce anxiety and stress
High-intent keywords: ADHD therapy St. Louis, Anxiety therapy St. Louis, anxiety therapy St. Louis, Neurodivergent therapist St. Louis, Neurodivergent therapy St. Louis, Late diagnosis ADHD, anxiety, autism therapy St. Louis
Local anchors: Webster Groves, St. Louis County, Kirkwood, Clayton, Central West End, Ladue
Representative quotes:
- I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
- I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
- I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.

quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.
persona_summary.prompt_block:
Audience pain points: Financial constraints, Difficulty asking for help, Perfectionism, Lack of time and energy, Fear of failure, Lack of self-compassion, Fear of judgment, Sensory sensitivities
Change goals: Develop healthier coping mechanisms, Improve emotional regulation, Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve focus and concentration, Build stronger relationships, Reduce anxiety and stress
High-intent keywords: ADHD therapy St. Louis, Anxiety therapy St. Louis, anxiety therapy St. Louis, Neurodivergent therapist St. Louis, Neurodivergent therapy St. Louis, Late diagnosis ADHD, anxiety, autism therapy St. Louis
Local anchors: Webster Groves, St. Louis County, Kirkwood, Clayton, Central West End, Ladue
Representative quotes:
- I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
- I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
- I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.

rag_snippets:
The Unraveling Autistic Adult: Seeking clarity and self-understanding after years of masking.
Pain points: Internalized ableism, Fear of judgment and rejection, Lack of self-compassion
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve emotional regulation, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load right now, and I want to acknowledge the strength it takes to reach out. Many folks come to Enlitens feeling like they're unraveling, realizing that the strategies they've used for years are no longer working. You're not alone in this.

Overwhelmed & Overcommitted: The 'Next Right Thing' Seeker: Drowning in the present, seeking clarity and a path forward.
Pain points: Perfectionism, Fear of failure, Difficulty asking for help
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Develop better coping mechanisms for ADHD, Improve time management and organization skills
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load, and it's completely understandable that you're feeling overwhelmed. Your journey through life, particularly with a late ADHD diagnosis, has likely been marked by both strengths and significant challenges. We can work together to unpack

The Overwhelmed ADHD Graduate Student: Navigating academic pressure and adulting with ADHD.
Pain points: Internalized stigma around ADHD, Perfectionism, Fear of failure
Goals: Improve time management and organization skills, Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: This client presents with classic signs of ADHD burnout, exacerbated by the pressures of a demanding graduate program. She's likely been masking for years, and the increased demands have pushed her past her breaking point. Our work together will focus on validating her experience

persona_quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

persona_quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.
client_insights.persona_prompt_block:
Audience pain points: Financial constraints, Difficulty asking for help, Perfectionism, Lack of time and energy, Fear of failure, Lack of self-compassion, Fear of judgment, Sensory sensitivities
Change goals: Develop healthier coping mechanisms, Improve emotional regulation, Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve focus and concentration, Build stronger relationships, Reduce anxiety and stress
High-intent keywords: ADHD therapy St. Louis, Anxiety therapy St. Louis, anxiety therapy St. Louis, Neurodivergent therapist St. Louis, Neurodivergent therapy St. Louis, Late diagnosis ADHD, anxiety, autism therapy St. Louis
Local anchors: Webster Groves, St. Louis County, Kirkwood, Clayton, Central West End, Ladue
Representative quotes:
- I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
- I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
- I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.

quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

persona_quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.

I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

Audience pain points: Financial constraints, Difficulty asking for help, Perfectionism, Lack of time and energy, Fear of failure, Lack of self-compassion, Fear of judgment, Sensory sensitivities
Change goals: Develop healthier coping mechanisms, Improve emotional regulation, Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve focus and concentration, Build stronger relationships, Reduce anxiety and stress
High-intent keywords: ADHD therapy St. Louis, Anxiety therapy St. Louis, anxiety therapy St. Louis, Neurodivergent therapist St. Louis, Neurodivergent therapy St. Louis, Late diagnosis ADHD, anxiety, autism therapy St. Louis
Local anchors: Webster Groves, St. Louis County, Kirkwood, Clayton, Central West End, Ladue

- I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.

- I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
rag_snippets:
The Unraveling Autistic Adult: Seeking clarity and self-understanding after years of masking.
Pain points: Internalized ableism, Fear of judgment and rejection, Lack of self-compassion
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve emotional regulation, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load right now, and I want to acknowledge the strength it takes to reach out. Many folks come to Enlitens feeling like they're unraveling, realizing that the strategies they've used for years are no longer working. You're not alone in this.

Overwhelmed & Overcommitted: The 'Next Right Thing' Seeker: Drowning in the present, seeking clarity and a path forward.
Pain points: Perfectionism, Fear of failure, Difficulty asking for help
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Develop better coping mechanisms for ADHD, Improve time management and organization skills
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load, and it's completely understandable that you're feeling overwhelmed. Your journey through life, particularly with a late ADHD diagnosis, has likely been marked by both strengths and significant challenges. We can work together to unpack

The Overwhelmed ADHD Graduate Student: Navigating academic pressure and adulting with ADHD.
Pain points: Internalized stigma around ADHD, Perfectionism, Fear of failure
Goals: Improve time management and organization skills, Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: This client presents with classic signs of ADHD burnout, exacerbated by the pressures of a demanding graduate program. She's likely been masking for years, and the increased demands have pushed her past her breaking point. Our work together will focus on validating her experience

The Adult-Diagnosed Executive Function Struggler: Navigating adult life with newly realized ADHD.
Pain points: Lack of time and energy., Financial constraints., Fear of judgment.
Goals: Improve executive function skills., Manage anxiety and depression., Develop healthier coping mechanisms.
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load right now, and I want to honor the strength it takes to reach out for support. You've navigated life with ADHD, perhaps without knowing the full picture, and now you're at a point where the strategies that once worked are no longer enou

The Overwhelmed ADHD Intern: Navigating professional demands while managing ADHD.
Pain points: Perfectionism, Fear of failure, Lack of time
Goals: Improve time management and organization, Reduce anxiety and stress, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: This highly intelligent and compassionate individual is facing a common challenge: navigating the intense demands of a helping profession while simultaneously managing their own neurodivergence. The key here is not just symptom management, but cultivating self-compassion and buil

The Overwhelmed ADHD Grad Student: Navigating academic pressures and the complexities of ADHD.
Pain points: Perfectionism, Fear of failure, Lack of self-compassion
Goals: Improve time management and organization skills, Reduce anxiety and stress levels, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load, juggling the demands of a rigorous PsyD program with the everyday challenges of ADHD. It's completely understandable that you're feeling overwhelmed. It takes incredible strength to recognize when you need support, and I commend you fo

Anxious College Student Seeking First-Time Therapy: Navigating college life with anxiety and depression, ready to explore therapy.
Pain points: Financial constraints (needs sliding scale payment), Fear of vulnerability and judgment, Lack of time due to school and work commitments
Goals: Reduce anxiety and panic attacks, Improve mood and energy levels, Develop healthy coping mechanisms
Tone: This young woman is taking a brave first step in seeking help for her anxiety and depression. The transition to college is often a challenging time, and it's understandable that she's feeling overwhelmed. Her willingness to explore therapy, despite financial concerns and potentia

Anxious Parent Advocate: Navigating neurodivergence in my child and family.
Pain points: Her own anxiety and perfectionism., Lack of time and energy., Financial constraints.
Goals: Help her daughter succeed in school and life., Improve her own emotional regulation skills., Reduce stress and anxiety.
Tone: As a parent navigating the complexities of neurodivergence, you're likely carrying a heavy load. Witnessing your child's struggles can bring up your own unresolved anxieties and past experiences. It's completely understandable to feel overwhelmed and uncertain about how to best s

The Overwhelmed and Newly Diagnosed: Navigating late diagnosis and seeking understanding amidst burnout.
Pain points: Lack of understanding and support from family and friends, Difficulty navigating social situations, Sensory overload
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve social skills and build stronger relationships, Develop healthy coping mechanisms for managing stress
Tone: It's clear this person is navigating a complex intersection of late diagnosis, sensory sensitivities, and the overwhelming pressure of daily life. They're likely feeling a mix of relief at finally understanding themselves and anxiety about how to move forward. My approach would b

Navigating Neurodivergence: The Supportive Parent: Advocating for my child's unique needs in a world that doesn't always understand.
Pain points: Lack of affordable and accessible therapy options., Limited time and energy due to the demands of parenting., Resistance from her child or other family members.
Goals: Help her child develop healthy social skills., Reduce her child's anxiety and meltdowns., Improve communication within the family.
Tone: As a parent navigating the complexities of raising a neurodivergent child, you carry an immense weight. The journey is often filled with moments of profound love and connection, alongside the challenges of advocating for your child's unique needs in a world that wasn't designed f

The Juggling Neurodivergent Parent: Seeking clarity and connection amidst the chaos of raising a neurodivergent family.
Pain points: Lack of time and energy, Financial constraints, Fear of judgment and stigma
Goals: Improve communication with her husband, Develop better emotional regulation skills, Reduce feelings of overwhelm and burnout
Tone: Sarah's story is one of resilience and a deep desire to understand herself and her family better. She carries the weight of years of undiagnosed neurodivergence, which has manifested in anxiety, burnout, and relationship challenges. Her commitment to creating a neurodivergent-aff

Navigating Life Transitions & Trauma Healing: Seeking guidance and support through life's significant changes while healing from past trauma.
Pain points: Lack of time and energy, Financial constraints, Fear of vulnerability
Goals: Improve self-care skills, Better understand and manage social anxiety, Heal from past trauma
Tone: This individual is navigating significant life transitions while also grappling with the impact of past trauma and neurodivergent experiences. They are seeking a therapist who can provide guidance and support as they navigate these challenges. It's important to create a safe and

persona_quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.

Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.

rag_snippets:
The Unraveling Autistic Adult: Seeking clarity and self-understanding after years of masking.
Pain points: Internalized ableism, Fear of judgment and rejection, Lack of self-compassion
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve emotional regulation, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load right now, and I want to acknowledge the strength it takes to reach out. Many folks come to Enlitens feeling like they're unraveling, realizing that the strategies they've used for years are no longer working. You're not alone in this.

Overwhelmed & Overcommitted: The 'Next Right Thing' Seeker: Drowning in the present, seeking clarity and a path forward.
Pain points: Perfectionism, Fear of failure, Difficulty asking for help
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Develop better coping mechanisms for ADHD, Improve time management and organization skills
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load, and it's completely understandable that you're feeling overwhelmed. Your journey through life, particularly with a late ADHD diagnosis, has likely been marked by both strengths and significant challenges. We can work together to unpack

The Overwhelmed ADHD Graduate Student: Navigating academic pressure and adulting with ADHD.
Pain points: Internalized stigma around ADHD, Perfectionism, Fear of failure
Goals: Improve time management and organization skills, Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: This client presents with classic signs of ADHD burnout, exacerbated by the pressures of a demanding graduate program. She's likely been masking for years, and the increased demands have pushed her past her breaking point. Our work together will focus on validating her experience

The Adult-Diagnosed Executive Function Struggler: Navigating adult life with newly realized ADHD.
Pain points: Lack of time and energy., Financial constraints., Fear of judgment.
Goals: Improve executive function skills., Manage anxiety and depression., Develop healthier coping mechanisms.
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load right now, and I want to honor the strength it takes to reach out for support. You've navigated life with ADHD, perhaps without knowing the full picture, and now you're at a point where the strategies that once worked are no longer enou

The Overwhelmed ADHD Intern: Navigating professional demands while managing ADHD.
Pain points: Perfectionism, Fear of failure, Lack of time
Goals: Improve time management and organization, Reduce anxiety and stress, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: This highly intelligent and compassionate individual is facing a common challenge: navigating the intense demands of a helping profession while simultaneously managing their own neurodivergence. The key here is not just symptom management, but cultivating self-compassion and buil

The Overwhelmed ADHD Grad Student: Navigating academic pressures and the complexities of ADHD.
Pain points: Perfectionism, Fear of failure, Lack of self-compassion
Goals: Improve time management and organization skills, Reduce anxiety and stress levels, Develop healthier coping mechanisms

Anxious College Student Seeking First-Time Therapy: Navigating college life with anxiety and depression, ready to explore therapy.
Pain points: Financial constraints (needs sliding scale payment), Fear of vulnerability and judgment, Lack of time due to school and work commitments
Goals: Reduce anxiety and panic attacks, Improve mood and energy levels, Develop healthy coping mechanisms
Tone: This young woman is taking a brave first step in seeking help for her anxiety and depression. The transition to college is often a challenging time, and it's understandable that she's feeling overwhelmed. Her willingness to explore therapy, despite financial concerns and potentia

Anxious Parent Advocate: Navigating neurodivergence in my child and family.
Pain points: Her own anxiety and perfectionism., Lack of time and energy., Financial constraints.
Goals: Help her daughter succeed in school and life., Improve her own emotional regulation skills., Reduce stress and anxiety.
Tone: As a parent navigating the complexities of neurodivergence, you're likely carrying a heavy load. Witnessing your child's struggles can bring up your own unresolved anxieties and past experiences. It's completely understandable to feel overwhelmed and uncertain about how to best s

The Overwhelmed and Newly Diagnosed: Navigating late diagnosis and seeking understanding amidst burnout.
Pain points: Lack of understanding and support from family and friends, Difficulty navigating social situations, Sensory overload
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve social skills and build stronger relationships, Develop healthy coping mechanisms for managing stress
Tone: It's clear this person is navigating a complex intersection of late diagnosis, sensory sensitivities, and the overwhelming pressure of daily life. They're likely feeling a mix of relief at finally understanding themselves and anxiety about how to move forward. My approach would b

Navigating Neurodivergence: The Supportive Parent: Advocating for my child's unique needs in a world that doesn't always understand.
Pain points: Lack of affordable and accessible therapy options., Limited time and energy due to the demands of parenting., Resistance from her child or other family members.
Goals: Help her child develop healthy social skills., Reduce her child's anxiety and meltdowns., Improve communication within the family.

The Juggling Neurodivergent Parent: Seeking clarity and connection amidst the chaos of raising a neurodivergent family.
Pain points: Lack of time and energy, Financial constraints, Fear of judgment and stigma
Goals: Improve communication with her husband, Develop better emotional regulation skills, Reduce feelings of overwhelm and burnout

Navigating Life Transitions & Trauma Healing: Seeking guidance and support through life's significant changes while healing from past trauma.
Pain points: Lack of time and energy, Financial constraints, Fear of vulnerability

persona_quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

rag_snippets:
The Unraveling Autistic Adult: Seeking clarity and self-understanding after years of masking.
Pain points: Internalized ableism, Fear of judgment and rejection, Lack of self-compassion
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve emotional regulation, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load right now, and I want to acknowledge the strength it takes to reach out. Many folks come to Enlitens feeling like they're unraveling, realizing that the strategies they've used for years are no longer working. You're not alone in this.

Overwhelmed & Overcommitted: The 'Next Right Thing' Seeker: Drowning in the present, seeking clarity and a path forward.
Pain points: Perfectionism, Fear of failure, Difficulty asking for help
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Develop better coping mechanisms for ADHD, Improve time management and organization skills
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load, and it's completely understandable that you're feeling overwhelmed. Your journey through life, particularly with a late ADHD diagnosis, has likely been marked by both strengths and significant challenges. We can work together to unpack

The Overwhelmed ADHD Graduate Student: Navigating academic pressure and adulting with ADHD.
Pain points: Internalized stigma around ADHD, Perfectionism, Fear of failure
Goals: Improve time management and organization skills, Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: This client presents with classic signs of ADHD burnout, exacerbated by the pressures of a demanding graduate program. She's likely been masking for years, and the increased demands have pushed her past her breaking point. Our work together will focus on validating her experience

The Adult-Diagnosed Executive Function Struggler: Navigating adult life with newly realized ADHD.
Pain points: Lack of time and energy., Financial constraints., Fear of judgment.
Goals: Improve executive function skills., Manage anxiety and depression., Develop healthier coping mechanisms.
Tone: It sounds like you're carrying a heavy load right now, and I want to honor the strength it takes to reach out for support. You've navigated life with ADHD, perhaps without knowing the full picture, and now you're at a point where the strategies that once worked are no longer enou

The Overwhelmed ADHD Intern: Navigating professional demands while managing ADHD.
Pain points: Perfectionism, Fear of failure, Lack of time
Goals: Improve time management and organization, Reduce anxiety and stress, Develop healthier coping mechanisms
Tone: This highly intelligent and compassionate individual is facing a common challenge: navigating the intense demands of a helping profession while simultaneously managing their own neurodivergence. The key here is not just symptom management, but cultivating self-compassion and buil

The Overwhelmed ADHD Grad Student: Navigating academic pressures and the complexities of ADHD.
Pain points: Perfectionism, Fear of failure, Lack of self-compassion
Goals: Improve time management and organization skills, Reduce anxiety and stress levels, Develop healthier coping mechanisms

Anxious College Student Seeking First-Time Therapy: Navigating college life with anxiety and depression, ready to explore therapy.
Pain points: Financial constraints (needs sliding scale payment), Fear of vulnerability and judgment, Lack of time due to school and work commitments
Goals: Reduce anxiety and panic attacks, Improve mood and energy levels, Develop healthy coping mechanisms
Tone: This young woman is taking a brave first step in seeking help for her anxiety and depression. The transition to college is often a challenging time, and it's understandable that she's feeling overwhelmed. Her willingness to explore therapy, despite financial concerns and potentia

Anxious Parent Advocate: Navigating neurodivergence in my child and family.
Pain points: Her own anxiety and perfectionism., Lack of time and energy., Financial constraints.
Goals: Help her daughter succeed in school and life., Improve her own emotional regulation skills., Reduce stress and anxiety.
Tone: As a parent navigating the complexities of neurodivergence, you're likely carrying a heavy load. Witnessing your child's struggles can bring up your own unresolved anxieties and past experiences. It's completely understandable to feel overwhelmed and uncertain about how to best s

The Overwhelmed and Newly Diagnosed: Navigating late diagnosis and seeking understanding amidst burnout.
Pain points: Lack of understanding and support from family and friends, Difficulty navigating social situations, Sensory overload
Goals: Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve social skills and build stronger relationships, Develop healthy coping mechanisms for managing stress

Navigating Neurodivergence: The Supportive Parent: Advocating for my child's unique needs in a world that doesn't always understand.
Pain points: Lack of affordable and accessible therapy options., Limited time and energy due to the demands of parenting., Resistance from her child or other family members.

persona_quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

quotes: I'm looking for a therapist with experience in autism and neurodivergence.
I am a self diagnosed autistic person that needs help talking through stuff.
I am dealing with issues with substances & attatchment.
Lately, I am constantly overwhelmed and feel like I am falling behind, regardless of whether I am making 'progress' at all.
I have had a lot of life, much of which I don't remember, and need someone to help navigate how to do the next right things.
I'm a psyd student at internship
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
I have been diagnosed with ADHD since I was a kid but I think I may fit better with a spectrum diagnosis.
I am not familiar with the process of finding one and I am not sure what exactly I may need.
It's been a little while since I was in therapy and I really feel like I need to go back.
I just need to talk a lot of that out.
I am unsure that my insurance will cover much or any so I wanted to discuss sliding scale payment as well.
Looking for a therapist to help navigate this stressful time for her, especially concerning school!
We are looking for a therapist that has experience with neurodivergence so she has someone to talk to about her experiences and help her better understand herself.
Looking for in-person therapy for a combo of anxiety/burnout (long term), compulsive eating (recent) and probably some undiagnosed Neuro differences.
Prefer a female provider
Primary concerns are irritability, negative self-talk, and angry outbursts. No reported concerns at school.
I’m looking for someone who he can talk to besides us about things that bother him.
We are very supportive of him being him and want him to be successful in what he wants to pursue.
I’m a late-diagnosed ADHD woman seeking a better therapeutic fit.

Audience pain points: Financial constraints, Difficulty asking for help, Perfectionism, Lack of time and energy, Fear of failure, Lack of self-compassion, Fear of judgment, Sensory sensitivities
Change goals: Develop healthier coping mechanisms, Improve emotional regulation, Reduce anxiety and overwhelm, Improve focus and concentration, Build stronger relationships, Reduce anxiety and stress

Local anchors: Webster Groves, St. Louis County, Kirkwood, Clayton, Central West End, Ladue
